response_parsed.title: Implementing REST APIs Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to create efficient and scalable REST APIs using the modern web framework, FastAPI, in conjunction with Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI is a high-performance, easy-to-use, and intuitive web framework for building RESTful APIs with Python.
FastAPI supports type hints, automatic documentation generation, and integration with popular libraries such as Starlette and Pydantic.
FastAPI has built-in support for OpenAPI 3.0 specifications, making it easy to generate client SDKs, API mocks, and visual API documentation.
Python 3.12+ is required for using FastAPI with its latest features like improved PEP 582 support, type hints improvements, and more.
FastAPI can be easily integrated with databases, authentication systems, caching, and other common backend services.

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for running the examples provided in this guide.
It is highly recommended to stay updated on FastAPI updates as new features and improvements are frequently added.
caveats: FastAPI requires a runtime environment with async/await support, such as Python 3.7+ or PyPy3
For integrating FastAPI with databases, you will need to install additional packages, like SQLAlchemy or Motor
